answers.answer: Hi,have you been tested for Diabetes?Everyone is different, you need to conceder other health problems that could have an impact so it would be imposable to give you an answer.If you have been diagnosed with  Alcohol Neuropathy then you need to stop drinking, each drink you take will cost you in pain. Eventually you have problems with muscle wasting and all that goes with it.

Hi rod44.  No I don't have diabetes.  I check my sugar regularly and it is around 92.  And no I have not been diagnosed with  Alcohol Neuropathy.  I was searching the internet about symptoms and that is why I am asking.

Burning pain on the skin starting in the feet, pins and needles muscle cramps (calf muscles) and fasciculation (small muscle twitching under the skin that feel like ants crawling on your skin) are the first symptoms I experienced.I think it is not so much the amount you drink but the way your body deals with it.see a doctor, diagnosing through the internet will drive you crazy.
Beer has been especially linked to gout attacks. My brother was a big beer drinker until a year ago when he got gout.
rod44, How many years were you drinking before your symptoms?
I would say you chances of messing up your liver are pretty good drinking that many beers. Plus you will get fat & get a beer gut like my brother did. STOP.

Last October I was diagnosed  with peripheral neuropathy. I believe they are one in the same is that correct?Also my diagnosis was made when a neurologist ran an EEG that showed my brain having one seizure after another so small I dont know I am having them. If they are the same are you medicated to control the seizures? Do you have seizures? I get the pins and needles though I am not diebetic.I have a post in the liver disorders group that explains the rest of my story if you care to read it.Randy

Hi rpoo, I have been watching all your posts (get a kick out of some lol) and you are an inspiration my friend. Stick with it, you are doing well. This is a fantastic place for support. I will go look the liver disorder group post as I have not seen it.I don't get  seizure now but did get them (pseudoseizures) during detox.Yes peripheral neuropathy and alcohol neuropathy are the same, the way I was diagnosed was with Nerve Conduction Study s and Lab work.
